parameters: \pop[2]In this situation, I don't think I had much of a choice.

\pop[2]Those pill bottles. I recognized the name of the medication.
\pop[2]They were tranquilizers, meant to relieve anxiety, fear, and stress.
\pop[2]Should he really be mixing those with alcohol like that?
\pop[2]Either way, a lot of things started to make sense in my head.
\pop[2]Ever since he arrived, he's been so calm and soft-spoken.
\pop[2]Definitely a far cry from how you'd imagine a popstar to be.

\pop[2]Maybe I should be as nice and supportive as possible.
\pop[2]But not in a way that reveals my awareness of his situation.
\pop[3]Do you ever wonder what'll happen when you're gone?
\pop[3]Not that stuff about returning to the stars...
I mean here, on Earth. Like, consequences and stuff.
\pop[3]I've been thinking about that a \c[14]lot\c[0] since The Wayfarer, actually.
Especially since we were talking about legacies.
\i[3]"I don't think we're ever gone, as long as we exist in memories."

I think you just changed my mind, Delta.
\pop[3]Well, I thought my legacy would be my music.
And when I was gone, people would listen to my songs.
\pop[3]It's not about the songs. It's what they feel while they listen.
Music has \c[14]always\c[0] been about sharing emotions with the world.
\pop[3]Helping people work through their tough times...
Giving them happiness, hope; maybe even love.
\pop[3]My legacy will be in the love of those I've left behind.
And by sharing it, they can make the world a better place.
It's about \c[14]me\c[0], and my effect on people.
\pop[2]He places his hand in mine, with a soft grip, as we look up at the sky.
\pop[2]He takes another sip, and we stand there, staring at the sky.
\pop[3]You know, I've got a few people up there. In the stars...
I can only wonder, as they watch, if I've made them proud.
\i[3]"I'm sure you've made them incredibly proud."
\i[3]"Might not be good to put that much pressure on yourself."
\i[3]"I'm sure you've made them incredibly proud."
I'll have to ask them when I see them again.
\i[3]"Might not be good to put that much pressure on yourself."
I'll just ask them when I see them again.
\pop[2]With a nervous laugh, he rubs the back of his head.

\pop[3]Especially with everything that's been going on lately.

\pop[2]I look over at Klace, and he's tugging at his scarf, almost looking nervous.
\pop[2]It's impossible for me to look at him the same anymore, knowing what I know now.

\pop[2]And to lie about it...? Saying it's notes for his memories?

Probably the one I'm gonna perform tonight.
